sentence.text: The sideroblastic anemias are a heterogeneous group of inherited and acquired disorders characterized by the presence of ring sideroblasts in the bone marrow.
Refractory anemia with ring sideroblasts (RARS) is a myelodysplastic syndrome characterized mainly by anemia attributable to ineffective erythropoiesis.

Inhibitors of molecules of the transforming growth factor-Î² superfamily have been shown recently to target ineffective erythropoiesis and ameliorate anemia both in animal models of myelodysplastic syndrome and in RARS patients.
